Articles.Content: Yeah this Mod is so amazing, I cannot understand why it is halted.

Yeah this Mod is so amazing, I cannot understand why it is halted.

Because Nothke had not spare time for it this week, so no progress. He was streaming the other day and I asked him.

I'm sick of the terrible huge life support resource modules available.

Would it help if you had a KAS container which can hold LS resources rather than parts?

There's a config for it in the KAS thread.

Just one idea on mod mechanics that may be interesting (and also great mods and textures BTW, I like both FLEXrack and 6S mods).

How about (and to have a different/complimentary market to KAS) making the experiments of FLEXrack a low-yield, high-repeateable, expendable experiments?.

For example, let's say each rack experiment gives you on basis (be it kerbin) 1 point of research and can be made up to 30 times with 3 constrains.

1.- Must be activated in EVA.

2.- Must be processed through the science station (then you go from 0 to 1 point).

3.- Must be then shipped back to Earth (unable to perform transmission).

In this way you have a science "grinder" that demands a lot of logistics, base development and EVA interaction (specially when you go further to other planets), which could be quite entertaining .

This could make KAS for building/mantenance and the Flexrack to hauling cargo elements of interest (like the life support mods for example).

Also, we have to bear in mind that the money/prestige system is still to be developed so it could be that some of these aspects could fit in this mod to make sure it has its own nichÃƒÂ© in KSP

Because Nothke had not spare time for it this week, so no progress. He was streaming the other day and I asked him.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/66578-Early-WIP-Bingo-Aerospace-Blizzard-B9-styled-modular-cockpit-for-HL-fuselage?p=917039#post917039
I really wish I could use this now... Ah well.
BUMP! Can't let Nothke forget about this.

BUMP! Can't let Nothke forget about this.

I'm sure he hasn't...

Yep, this would aid greatly in all sorts of things Nothke.

Very interested.

Yep, this would aid greatly in all sorts of things Nothke.

Very interested.

*Gasp*

You're alive!
0_0 wow it's fusty
Fusty... the memories...

*Gasp*

You're alive!

He's here!

I for one would gladly go back to using life support mods once this comes out!

team.leit

Guys, Nothke said he's busy with that thing we call "life", so I don't think he's got a lot of time for this.

Yep, this would aid greatly in all sorts of things Nothke.

Very interested.

*Faints*
Thanks to Fusty's resurrection, and him poking me every 15 minutes, I was forced to work on this today. Just so you know.

good to see this being worked on again:D! Also i noticed that you removed the TPS pack link from your signature.

anyway can't wait to see this released

If poking is what it takes I am sure most viewers of your FLEXrack pictures/videos over the past 5-6 months would be happy to do so around the clock if it meant that some form of this would make it out of your hands sooner than soon.

Edited February 11, 2014 by sirklick

/poke

/poke

/poke

/poke

/poke

Seriously, it's nice to hear that you're still working on this. Honestly with all the things you're working on I was worried you might have forgotten this.

Great job fusty! Keep it up! Poke Nothke to work on this!

No, seriously now, glad to hear you worked on this

Poke him!

Can wait for this mod. I have actively followed it for about 5 months and some real progress seems to be being made. Great job Nothke, and good luck!

I agree POKE!

I have waited since this i first saw this mod in June and will not quit until this is out
Nothke: Maybe you could do alpha release with just the SuperStrapTM packages? They look complete to me and they aren't then it wouldn't be hard for someone to add life support in.

Nothke: Maybe you could do alpha release with just the SuperStrapTM packages? They look complete to me and they aren't then it wouldn't be hard for someone to add life support in.

I'd like to also second this. I've been holding off on playing KSP lately because, while I really like to play with life support, good looking and reasonably sized containers just don't exist. The SuperStrap soft packs are amazing and would be so cool to slip a bunch into the in-line containers for a resupply launch, or to aesthetically store for long distance journeys

I too have been holding off on KSP waiting for this mod to come online (remember we're waiting for this to get the next version of Fustek also). This is probably the most anticipated mod out there, so Nothke, if I can add any sort of encouragement without upping the pressure too high, please please work on this.

Regards,

Bez
